i1.name: Headshot
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Caitlyn's''' basic attacks generate a stack of ''Headshot'' [[on-attack]], doubled when attacking from {{tip|brush}}. At 6 stacks, or 5 while in ''brush'', '''Caitlyn's''' next [[basic attack]] becomes {{tip|unstoppable basic attack|unstoppable}} and deals {{as|({{passive progression/deprecated version|3|key=%|50 to 100|1 to 13}}|ad}} {{as|+ {{critical damage|125|62.5}} critical strike chance|critical chance}}{{as|) AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, increased to {{as|(100%|AD}} {{as|+ {{critical damage|125|62.5}} critical strike chance|critical chance}}{{as|) AD}} against non-champions.
'''Caitlyn''' may fire other empowered basic attacks until ''Headshot'' hits a target, which consumes all stacks.

Enemies that step over a {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} or are hit by {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn}} can grant an additional ''headshot'' at {{sti|range|1300 range}} for {{fd|1.8}} seconds, without consuming stacks of ''Headshot''.
i1.notes:
* The bonus range from {{ii|Rapid Firecannon}} will not have any effect during {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn|trap}} and {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn|net}} extended ''Headshot'' attacks.
* As with most on-hit physical damage, the bonus damage from ''Headshot'' will apply {{stil|life steal}}.
* Attacking {{tip|ward|wards}} or [[jungle plants]] will still generate stacks towards ''Headshot'' but the empowered attack will not be consumed.
* A stack is granted even if the attack is dodged
* The basic attack triggering ''Headshot'' can {{tip|critically strike}}, but ''Headshot's'' damage remains unchanged if it does.
* Ability-granted ''Headshots'' are abilities that apply [[on-hit]] effects. They will not interact with effects that apply [[on-attack]] (including stacking ''Headshot'').
** {{tip|Energized}}, which normally stacks [[on-attack]], has been special cased to stack [[on-hit]] for these empowered attacks.
* The bonus damage applies to {{tip|turret|turrets}}.
* Additional bolts from {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} will not generate stacks towards ''Headshot'' but will benefit from the {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn|trap}} and {{ai|90 Caliber Net|Caitlyn|net}} extended ''Headshot'' attack range.

q1.name: Piltover Peacemaker
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' fires a projectile in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy it passes through, after which it expands in width but deals only 60% damage to all enemies it passes thereafter.
Enemies {{tip|true sight|revealed}} by {{ai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} always take full damage from ''Piltover Peacemaker''.
q1.notes: * Enemies hit while protected by a {{tip|spell shield}} will still be considered a target for calculating damage for subsequent hits.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ % AD)
  • Reduced Damage: (+ % AD)

w1.name: Yordle Snap Trap
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Caitlyn''' periodically [[stock]]s a ''Yordle Snap Trap'' charge, up to a maximum amount.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' sets a visible {{tip|untargetable}} trap at the target location which briefly grants {{tip|sight}} of the area and arms after 1 second, lasting for a duration. After the maximum amount of traps is laid down, deploying another immediately destroys the oldest one.

The next enemy champion that springs the trap is {{tip|root|rooted}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds, {{tip|true sight|revealed}} for 3 seconds, takes additional damage from {{ai|Headshot|Caitlyn}}, and becomes immune to ''Yordle Snap Traps'' for 3 seconds.

''Yordle Snap Traps trigger simultaneously if stacked on top of each other, granting additional {{ai|Headshot|Caitlyn|Headshots}} for each one beyond the first, but only increasing the damage for the first one.''
w1.notes:
* If ''Yordle Snap Traps'' are stacked on each other while the target is already ''rooted'' by one, the target is immune to them for:
** 2 seconds for the 2nd and 3rd trap.
** 3 seconds for the 4th and 5th trap.
** Completely immune to them after the 5th trap.

effects.str: • Headshot Damage Increase: (+ % bonus AD)

st_slices: <HtmlTooltip class="champion-ability blue link" data-champkey="Caitlyn">Headshot<template #content>Headshot</template></HtmlTooltip> Damage Increase

subeffects.title: <HtmlTooltip class="champion-ability blue link" data-champkey="Caitlyn">Headshot<template #content>Headshot</template></HtmlTooltip> Damage Increase

e1.name: 90 Caliber Net
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' fires a net in the target direction and {{tip|dash|recoils}} 375 units in the opposite direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 50% for 1 second.
e1.notes: * The recoil can be used to pass through terrain.

r1.name: Ace in the Hole
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Caitlyn''' locks onto the target enemy {{tip|champion}} and {{tip|channel|channels}} for 1 second, {{tip|true sight|revealing}} them and {{tip|sight|revealing}} herself to enemies.
''Ace in the Hole'' is placed on a 5-second {{sti|cooldown}} if canceled.
Once '''Caitlyn''' completes the channel, she fires a homing bullet toward the target that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy champion it hits.
r1.notes:
* The following will cancel ''Ace in the Hole's'' channel (mana expenditure is not compensated):
** '''Caitlyn''' is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.
** The target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}.
** '''Caitlyn''' or her target {{tip|death|dies}}.
** '''Caitlyn''' uses {{si|Flash}}.
* The ability also goes on a 5-second {{sti|cooldown}} if '''Caitlyn''' enters {{tip|resurrection}} during the cast time.
** The cast time does not end prematurely but the channel will be immediately canceled the moment the cast time completes.
* If the target dies, becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, or '''Caitlyn''' loses {{tip|sight}} of them during the cast time, ''Ace in the Hole'' cancels but does not go on {{sti|cooldown}} nor consumes any {{tip|mana}}.
* If the target dies after the bullet has been fired, the shot will continue towards their corpse and may still hit other enemy champions.
** If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}} after the bullet has been fired, the projectile will be {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroyed}}.
* The target is {{tip|true sight|revealed}} during the channel and while the bullet is in-flight.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Caitlyn''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|attack=false|move=false|cast=false|items=false,true,false,false,false}}
